p: Antimicrobial results revealed that L. acacia was highly active against all tested bacteria. Interestingly, it was more active than standard drugs (Penicillin G 10 µg, Vancomycin 30 µg and Erythromycin 15 µg). While, C. proximus and C. obtusifolia were exhibited moderate activities towards some of the tested bacteria, as shown in Fig. 1, Fig. 2.
